sen.j: 禰宜（ねぎ）とは、神職の職称（職名）の一つである。
sen.e: Negi is an official title of Shinto priesthood.

sen.e: Today Negi is a title of assistants to Guji and its official rank is lower than Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) and higher than Gonnegi (general staff of a shrine).

sen.j: 禰宜の語源は「和ませる」の意味の古語「ねぐ」である。
sen.e: Nagi originates from the word of "Negu" with a meaning of "calming"

sen.e: This means praying protection of gods by calming their mind.

sen.e: In the old system, it was a title lower than Shinto priest and higher than Hafuri, or the general term for Shinto priesthood.
